messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: Samurai Armor books
messages.msgSnippet: ... Ah, I get you -- more an illustrated step by step thing. Fraid not -- the thing would be HUGE. Plus, for the record, there s nothing REMOTELY like the
messages.messageBody:
Michael wrote:

>
>
> Mr Bryant,
> No disrespect. your site is very well infomative. I guess I worded
> it wrong, I was looking for something a little more illustrated in
> the making process. Unfortunatly I am not able to read well. I have
> a strong dyslexia that makes your instructions text look like
> Einsteins theory of relitivity. I have made 3 sets of armor from
> barrel plastic just from your patterns as well as others just by
> looking at the pictures. I would just like to make a more genuine
> looking armor now.

Ah, I get you -- more an "illustrated step by step" thing. Fraid not -- the
thing would be HUGE. Plus, for the record, there's nothing REMOTELY like the
manual even in Japanese. Some folks are less than pleased that I did what I did
(being secrets of the craft and all).

Tony

--

Anthony J. Bryant
Website: http://www.sengokudaimyo.com

Effingham's Heraldic Avatars (...and stuff):
http://www.sengokudaimyo.com/avatarbiz.html

Grand Cross, Order of the Laurel:
http://www.cafepress.com/laurelorder

messages.subject: Re: Samurai Armor books
messages.msgSnippet: Mr Bryant, No disrespect. your site is very well infomative. I guess I worded it wrong, I was looking for something a little more illustrated in the making
messages.messageBody:
Mr Bryant,
No disrespect. your site is very well infomative. I guess I worded
it wrong, I was looking for something a little more illustrated in
the making process. Unfortunatly I am not able to read well. I have
a strong dyslexia that makes your instructions text look like
Einsteins theory of relitivity. I have made 3 sets of armor from
barrel plastic just from your patterns as well as others just by
looking at the pictures. I would just like to make a more genuine
looking armor now.

Michael

wrote:

> lol

ago)

to

messages.subject: Samurai Armor books
messages.msgSnippet: I have been searching the net for quite some time of Armor books to make armor. Mr Bryants site is very good, but I am looking for something with a little more
messages.messageBody:
I have been searching the net for quite some time of Armor books to
make armor. Mr Bryants site is very good, but I am looking for
something with a little more detailed information. Can anyone
recommend a book that can help me. English or Japanese language
doesn't matter.

Thank you
Michael
